intro: Pholidota pallida, commonly known as the white-flowered pholidota, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pale green to white leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
